TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataGridTextBox extends System.Windows.Forms.TextBox

Docs.summary: Represents a control that is hosted in a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBox> and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn> work together so that users can directly edit values in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> control column. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn> derives from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle>, and is designed to host the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBox>, which derives from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control.
In addition to the properties, events, and methods of the base control, you can call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyPress> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyDown> events with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnKeyPress%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnMouseDown%2A> methods.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to get the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBox> hosted by a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn>.
[!code-cpp[Classic DataGridTextBox Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic DataGridTextBox Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic DataGridTextBox Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic DataGridTextBox Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic DataGridTextBox Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic DataGridTextBox Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the is in a mode that allows either editing or navigating.
Docs.value: if the controls is in navigation mode, and editing has not begun; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBox.IsInEditOrNavigateMode%2A> property is used within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ProcessKeyMessage%2A> to determine how to process key press events, to check the state of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBox>. For example, if one of the navigation (arrow) keys is pressed, the appropriate action for the state of the control must occur.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member.
[!code-cpp[DataGridTextBox_IsInEditOrNavigateMode#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/DataGridTextBox_IsInEditOrNavigateMode/CPP/datagridtextbox_isineditornavigatemode.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[DataGridTextBox_IsInEditOrNavigateMode#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/DataGridTextBox_IsInEditOrNavigateMode/CS/datagridtextbox_isineditornavigatemode.cs#1)] [!code-vb[DataGridTextBox_IsInEditOrNavigateMode#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/DataGridTextBox_IsInEditOrNavigateMode/VB/datagridtextbox_isineditornavigatemode.vb#1)]
